discussion.p: This should talk about the object/function designated by `expr`/`fn`, rather than `expr`/`fn`.

li.pre: template<class T> consteval info reflect_object(T& expr);

blockquote.p: -8- Returns: A reflection of the object designated by `expr`.

-9- Throws: `meta::exception` if for an lvalue constant expression `E` that computes the object that `expr` refers to, `E` unless `expr` is not suitable for use as a constant template argument for a constant template parameter of type T& ().

li.pre: template<class T> consteval info reflect_function(T& expr);

blockquote.p: -11- Returns: A reflection of the function designated by `fn`.

-12- Throws: `meta::exception` if for an lvalue constant expression `F` that computes the function that `fn` refers to, `F` unless `fn` is not suitable for use as a constant template argument for a constant template parameter of type T& ().
